meanings.definition: To throw or cast something forcefully.
meanings.sent1: He was jaculating stones into the pond.
meanings.sent2: She jaculated the ball across the field.
meanings.sent3: The boy was jaculating pebbles at the cans for fun.
meanings.sent4: The wind was jaculating leaves in all directions.
meanings.sent5: The chef was jaculating spices into the sizzling pan.

meanings.sent1: The male bird was jaculating to fertilize the eggs.
meanings.sent2: He jaculated at an inappropriate time.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed surprised after jaculating on the carpet.
meanings.sent4: The fountain was jaculating water high into the air.
meanings.sent5: The volcano was jaculating lava violently during the eruption.
